Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2009 02:49PM 2new1s wrote: bee54 ~ Your luck sounds like the luck i have in life too!  NO LUCK WHAT SO EVER!!!!!!!!  Anything imaginable happens to me.  So I come to expect the worst of whatever the situation is & then I MAKE THE BEST OF IT!!!!!!!!  For example just today I had several errands to get completed today.  DS is on spring break so I took him & DD with so we could go for lunch after wards.  Well each errand took double or triple the time I had expected it to, due to long lines at the DMV, fax machine not working at police station, printer not working at lawyers office, etc!  The whole group of people of 50 people or so at the DMV enjoyed my DS & DD play and laughed together while we waited.  He is 16 & she is 22 months.  So she is easily amused by him and he loves her so much!  I also was brave enough to wear no coat - for once!  I had on my tshirt that is shown in my avatar.  (The avatar shows a tank - but I have the tshirt - I don't like my arms enough to wear a tank!).  I was proud of myself for being brave and not having DS run out to the car and get my coat so I could cover up.  With my left foob now filled to 450cc's and the right side caned in, it does look odd, but I just held my head high and thought "Get a good look now, because come the end of all this - you will really want to look at some "2reallyhot1s"!!!!!  LOL Okay now Bee54 ~ Thank you for complimenting me!  When I did work before I had DD, I was a secretary for our school district and when they found out I was leaving, there was staff & so many people including parents and kids that said the district would never be the same without my smile and sense of humor!  Till this day when I see people they ask when I would come back!  My MIL and DH also work for the same place.  So I do miss it dearly, but would never give up being able to be home with the kids, as long as it's financially possible - of course! How awful that you have to have the surgery to get the expander replaced.  Now I wonder to get to your desired size, how many more fills do you need?  Only wondering because if you are almost there, why not just have the exchange surgery and have her put the desired size put in as the final implant?  My left foob is filled 450cc's.  Not sure what cup size it is, but it looks awfully small to me.  I think because I was so used to by big fat droopy boobs!  Now this one is high, perky and tiny.  I want to be a "D".  So not sure how many cc's that would be??????? Bee, maybe fill up to a full "B", and see how you like it.  I know you joke about the belly sticking out more than the foobs, but honestly if you want to have some sort of chest, if it were me I would do the "C".  Only because women that I have personally spoke to that have implants have told me that they wish they went a little bigger.  But that's just my opinion of course!  I do not have my Easter decorations up and it is bothering me!  We store our holiday things in the basement and there is no way I could sort through everything to get them out.  I could have DS or DH help me and just stand there and direct them as to what to out, but my whole storage area with everything would end up looking like a disaster!  I have all my decorations sorted by holiday, but the boxes are not all marked.  I know what's in them by just a glance, but no one else would figure it out. Anywhoo...we ended up buying new baskets for the kids this year and I will have to be happy with that!  I already planned that next year I will donate the older baskets to DS's school for them to use in the office area or teacher's lounge.  Sorry for the super long post, but DD is watching a DVD, oh and I also took two vicodins after we got home due to the pain from driving way too much today!  LOL

Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2009 01:07PM 2new1s wrote: Bee54 ~ I agree with you - Where is everyone????????  Did our group fizzle out?  We can make our own new thread "BJ"  Bee & Jenni.  Bee your strong suit is that you are a wife, mother, & most important GRANDMA!!!!!!!!  Don't sell yourself short on those roles! Take the advice from me about not waiting for the dingalings at the PS's office to call you!  Keep calling them again & again until they have a date for the surgery.  If I had sat back and waited for return phone calls and insurance approvals, etc, I would probably be dead now!  So go pick up the phone and ask for the office manager, explain to her that you are in a tremendous amount of pain (lay it on thick if you have to), tell her you need the soonest date available for the surgery!  Remember - they WORK FOR YOU!!!!!!!!!  The hundreds of thousands of dollars they are making off you alone is paying for all of their salaries!  So go call now and let me know what they say!   Now who's the mother hen????????????  LOL

Thank you all for the advice on the "sex" situation of my DS.  I have talked to both of the mom's of the girls  involved.  Of course it is all my fault & DS's fault for the sex happening!  Like I was there cheering them on - give me a break!  Basically I agreed that at their age being "active" is not necessary!  At this point it's done & over - no going back.  I have told DS & the mom's that neither girl is welcome in our home again.  I want no part of more teenage GF/BF drama. Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2009 02:13PM 2new1s wrote: Hi ladies!!!!!  The best news ever.........they ran all of the preliminary testing on my dad and so far no reoccurring of cancer!  They let him go home on antibiotics and he will see his onc on Monday for the final results of everything.  They think it may have been just a cyst that popped (kind of like a pimple).  So I am sssssoooooooo very relieved as of now.  I will not be totally okay until after his appt on Monday.  So I want to thank you all for the added prayers sent our way, must have worked! I totally agree with those of you who said how much more can I handle right?  Not sure if I even want to answer the phone when it rings!  My PT went good this morning.  Had to take DD (23 months) with to the appt.  Since we are in a private room & the door is closed, the PT said just to bring her in with me.  I kept her occupied in her stroller with little snacks.  She actually did so good that we scheduled my next  appt for during the day! After we left PT, DD & I spent the rest of the day @ the mall.  I bought a new outfit for a concert DH & I are going to this Saturday night.  It was awfully disheartening to try on so many pretty tops that looked awful with my caved in chest & left foob filled to 600cc's.  I finally found a beautiful pastel top that has that flowey loose look to it.  The best part was that when I tried on a pair of jean capri pants - they were too big!  I went down a size!  I guess all of this stress had one advantage for me.  :) Needless to say I did NO housework today.  DH told me this morning not to bother about having something prepared for dinner since we didn't know what the status would be w/ my Dad.  Since Dad is home now.  We are ordering pizza - one of my favorites.    Enough rambling on for now.  All of you have a wonderful day/evening.  I am blessed to have all of you on this site!

Posts.Content: Feb 28, 2009 03:06PM 2new1s wrote: It is official, I now have only one nipple.  DH and I removed my bandages so I could shower and he actually saw before I did that the infected/dead nipple was gone.  I had not known for sure if the PS was able to save it or not.  When she had finished with my surgery, she went out to talk to my husband and they couldn't find him.  So she didn't tell the nurses either.  Before the surgery I knew there was the possibility of losing it, I still cried like a baby for about five minutes when I looked in the mirror.  After that I sucked it up and got into the shower.  Cried in the shower some more, but since then I have been fine.  PS also drained probably half of the 300cc's that were in the tissue expander since I also lost quite a bit of skin that was infected/dead.  So not sure what size I will able to go up to now.  Before the BM I was a 38C.  Right now I might be a 38A.  Of course now that she drained the right side, I look lopsided.  We went out to lunch and I had a loose fitting sweater on.  I still felt like everyone could tell that my foobs were uneven. I guess I will now start researching the nipple reconstruction threads.  From the pics I have seen on the forum, they do a very good job on the fipples!  Another adventure for me I guess.  I know it could have been worse, so I am thankful that the whole breast wasn't compromised. If any of you have any nipple reconstruction hints/stories to share please let me know. Thanks

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2009 12:21PM 2new1s wrote: suegmomof3 ~ Great to hear you are doing so good.  That nausea stage was so bad for me too.  I was even vomiting the night after I came home from the hospital.  I think it was just a matter of getting out all the anestesia meds out of my system. Posts.Content: Feb 27, 2009 10:29PM 2new1s wrote: Hi ladies, Okay here is yet another update from my 2/11/09 ~ BM nipple sparring - w/ TE and AlloDerm. I ended up developing a worse infection overnight and went in to see PS this morning.  The PS came into the office on her day off to check out the infection to see what was going on.  She ended up have to preform an emergency outpatient surgery to repair the infected breast tissue and the nipple, the procedure is also known as debridement.  My whole chest is wrapped in an ace bandage so I am sure what it looks like now.  Tomorrow I can remove the wrap so I will see what happened with the repair.  Since I have been photographing my surgery journey I will also take new pictures tomorrow so I will be able to tell exactly what was done.  When I have more healed photos I will add them on the picture forum.  Both of these sites have just been so beneficial to me for information and support.

Posts.Content: May 3, 2009 08:31AM 2new1s wrote: Hi ladies ~ Jillisucat ~ Like I said before, someday he'll grow up.  For now just hope & pray that he doesn't make too many wrong decisions. txbadboob ~ Your son sounds like he learned a hard lesson!  I have a cousin that just turned 40 and he spent his whole life from 18 - 37 in & out of prison.  All for dumb choices.  He never harmed anyone but was just doing dumb things with bad people.  For example being in a stolen car when he was on probation, so they sent him back to prison.  Talk about bad luck, he had the worst luck!  Now he is 40, has been out of prison for three years and is doing great.  Actually getting married this summer on my b-day! my560sel ~ To try & answer your ?'s about the BM:  I had my BM w/ AlloDerm & TE on 2/11.  If things went good, I would have been back on track in about 3 - 4 weeks.  I had complications so can't really help with the exact healing process.    The drains aren't too bad.  You can hide them in the pockets of a zip-up sweatshirt & go out in public and no one will know you have them.  I cut holes on the inside of the pocket & slipped the drain bulbs inside.  Now that the weather is getting warmer I did see short sleeved zip-ups at Macy's.  I will need to go buy one for when I have my TE replaced in June.  My chest looked normal with the TE's.  I now only have the left TE, but if I did have both I think it would look like I have regular boobs!  Some women say how they are square or odd shaped but my foob looks like a regular shape.  Not going to lie and say it doesn't hurt, because it sure does!  I have rean on here that once you get the final implants they are awesome!  That is what I am looking forward to. Bee54 ~ Keep up the great work with the DG.  That's all you can do ~ as you have learned! samiam40 ~ I did try and call the PS's office and the answering service says the dr doesn't call back unless it's an emergency!   Ummmm.........hello for me this is an emergency!  LOL.  I see her again next week and I will talk to her personally and see what the mix up was.  I honestly do not think she "lied" to me but that the secretary does not know that the PS told me she would do whatever she could to fit me in.  As of now I am done getting my hopes up and settling for a June surgery date.  I did also tell them that if they have a surgery cancellation I would take it.  Enjoy this beautiful day.  At least here it is not raining & the sun is out!

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2009 03:01PM 2new1s wrote: 4greatkids ~ Sorry that you are having such a rough time.  I had my BM on 2/11/09.  Since then I have had two additional surgeries due to infections.  I have had rough days, many rough nights, but I am still here fighting like hell to get through this.  I too was lucky to have my pathology come back clear.  For now I have one expander in and I am waiting until I can get the other one replaced. I also have been taking photos.  I have not had the courage yet to post them.  Maybe if I had both expanders as planned I would, but for now I will wait.  Buy the way, it's okay to have bad, bad days, just come on here and we will help you get past the bad days! Posts.Content: May 17, 2009 04:39AM 2new1s wrote: wabiarts ~ I also had a BM w/ TE's.  I think having someone with you overnight if possible for the first few days would be really helpful.  The worst part for me was emptying the drains.  I was too queasy to do it myself at first.  I did eventually drain them on my own after the first week.  Another hard lesson learned, do not try & lift a full gallon of milk or water!  Ouch, way too heavy!  Other than that you have already had really good advice.  Oh and have someone available to drive you to your follow up appointments.  Keep us posted on how you do.
